detailsOfAchievement: By comprehending the multi-pronged problems and the need-based demand & just aspirations of the rural vulnerable and marginalized sections at the grass-roots level, in and around, Kamdebpur Village under Magrahat-II Block in the prioritized backward South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal- a group of enterprising youth, under the stewardship of ever agile Dr. A.Jaman formed this voluntary organization, by name, Kamdebpur Rural Development Society (acronym being KRDS), way back on 1st January, 1984 with an aim to mitigate the sufferings of the marginalized ones, at the grass-roots level, through relentless engagements in multi-dimensional community developmental activities, on a sustained way. Vision-Ensuring attainment of upward status in Societal & Human Developmental Index (S.H.D.I). Mission- Organizing, facilitating, conducting, implementing, executing multifarious sustainable community development activities, through Peoples Participatory Approaches (PPA) with the assimilation of local, internal, external and human resources backed-up by appropriate technology. Current & past activities: Main activities of the Organization  Comprehensive health programme.  School of Nursing programme under NRHM /GOI.  SGSY & SHG formation and micro-credit activities.  Skill orientation training.  Creche programme.  Balwadi programme.  Women empowerment.  Community sensitization programme.  Organic farming.  Income generation programme., etc. It bears recall that the organization has enriched experience in conducting skill orientation training in different disciplines & achieves the success to get employment opportunity for the youth & women beneficiary (i) EDP training, Ministry of Food processing, GOI. (ii) Primary level food processing & preservation training at different blocks in South 24 Parganas, North 24 Parganas & Malda District with Department of FPI & H, Govt. of West Bengal. Initiation of SOYA NUGGET Manufacturing Unit for facilitating rural womens livelihood process on a sustained way. (iii) Leadership training amongst the SHG leaders. (iv) Paramedical courses being approved by West Bengal State Council of Technical Education, Govt. of West Bengal. (v) School of Nursing training under NRHM, Department of Health & FW, GoWB. (vi) Consumer awareness and FBP training of Department of Consumer awareness & FBP, GoWB. (vii) First Aid, Hygiene & sanitation, Home Nursing, St. John Ambulance Association. (viii) Condensed course training, CSWB, New Delhi. (ix) Readymade garments training & BOP under SGSY-DRDC programme. (x) Ambulance service for the poor & marginalized people. (xi) Awareness on environmental issues at village level.

title: KnIDS
detailsOfAchievement: Major activities were a study on practices for innovation in Indian industries, and also creation of dashboard on data generated in National Innovation survey. Major achievements are policy inputs for allying disconnect between innovation support system and the production system. Also developed the dashboard for NSI.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project was the follow up of the National Innovation Survey (NIS) undertaken by Department of Science and Technology. As follow up, the project was supposed to undertake case studies of about 130 firms at different levels of innovativeness identified in NIS for understanding the practices of the firms for promotion of enterprise level innovations.

DST database created through National Innovation Survey generated huge amount if data. There were requests from the researchers and policy makers for making the data and information accessible in a user friendly mode. The dashboard was to create interactive presentations of the data which was also to be available for download and further processing.
Continued with the project mentioned for earlier year.
New proposal for funding is pending with DST.

detailsOfAchievement: Facilitating the pulse-polio movement : kcap has played an instrumental role in facilitating the implementation of UNICEFs pulse polio program aimed at eradication of polio. We got the assignment of executing an issue-based publicity campaign in three districts of West Bengal viz. Birbhum, Murshidabad and Purba Medinipur. Children development workshop : We have always emanated our proclivity towards the health and environmental issues. in jharkhand and maheshtala of deoghar, we have conducted a series of workshops with the basic objective of improving the health status of the local children and adolescents. The primary segment encapsulated the children and the adolescents the secondary segment encompassed the parents of the children. Through the workshops the members of the secondary group were sensitized regarding the scientific techniques of child rearing which can play an important role in fostering the cognitive development, emotional maturity and physical well being of their offspring. Workshop for attitudinal engineering : We have executed customized workshops for the sex workers of Bangaon, Bashirhat and Matiya all in West Bengal with the basic objective of levitating their self-esteem. Experimental training on creativity : We are being driven by our indomitable spirit of engineering productive changes within the most impoverished human populace. In this process we have always endeavored to increase the potential elements within the young participants in different field of activities. Workshop on anti-trafficking : While conducting a workshop on strategies of trafficking prevention, at Bongohn, Swarupnagar, Sandeshkhali, Gaighata at North 24th Pargana and Mekhliguange at Kooch Bihar district all in West Bengal. The target audience encompassed the members of the local clubs. They requested us to float a theatrical production on trafficking, to make the common people sensitized regarding this delicate and sensitive social problem. Workshop against alcohol & drug abuse : Now let us enunciate another effort delivered by us to deploy the indomitable spirit of the poverty stricken people in the rural milieu. We took the initiative of executing an exhaustive and incisive awareness campaign against drug-abuse amidst different places including remote rural areas of West Bengal. Grants received : Received Production & Equipment Grant from Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India. Seminar & awareness programme on Legal rights for women supported by national commission for women. Our other achievements : We participated in awareness campaign through theatre on AIDS with WBSAPCS, NACO, PSI, and other social organization. Besides we performed awareness shows on the occasion of World AIDS Day since 2002. We design awareness campaign through theatre on RCH, Food adulteration, Malaria with IEC Division. We are involved in the programme with West Bengal Pollution Control Board. Campaign on child protection & rights with Save the children, Don Bosco, Child Line, Grouppe Developpement. We are working with slum children of Nabodisha, a Kolkata Police project on children. We have since received a few prominent awards. It is our aim to achieve all-out social development including understanding the value of life, education with cultural upliftment that will ultimately make people happy and prosperous.

In Tagores plays there can also be found an undertone of spirituality. True to his liberal background, he was invariably against religious bigotry, fanaticism, and other malpractices arising out of a misconceived sense of religion. In fact, he unequivocally attacked worn out and useless conventions that hampered the progress of mankind. Quintessence of religion consists in kindness and love towards all which in the play GURU is personified by Panchak and Acharya to great extent.

It is the story of a boy who tried hard to release his father from Kings prison. The story is narrated in the folk form of Gajan Gaan where Lord Shiva Himself is narrating the scenes while His disciple Nandi and Bhringi is shifting the simple sets. Children should be aware of the good as well as the bad elements of their environment for their run in real life. Children are easily deceived by the elder human beings. But the non-human members of our environment do not do so.

title: KOLKATA MAYUR LALIT DANCE ACADEMY
detailsOfAchievement: Kolkata Mayur Lalit Dance Academy, a non-profitable cultural organization, registered under Government of West Bengal Societies Act, affiliated with Pracheen Kala Kendra, Chandigarh is very much involved in cultivation and promotion of Odissi, sublime classical dance form of India along with research oriented projects involving the same. Experimenting with various other classical music and applying them to the movements of Odissi adds a new dimension to the age old dance form. Our work on fusion of dying art form, Kirtan and Odissi, involving and incorporating its rhythm in Odissi dance form, thus creating an innovative Odissi dance drama based on Padabali Kirtan has earned much accolades from various distinguished corners, raving reviews from press, acknowledgement from experts including recognition from Ministry of Culture, Government of India in the form of Production Grant for the same. Besides educating students on the nuances and techniques of Odissi at our academy at Kolkata, we also haD a branch of our Odissi Academy at Alipurduar in Jalpaiguri district of North Bengal. This is quite notable that this Dooars region of North Bengal which is 750 kms away from Kolkata, the cultural capital of India, was getting enriched with classical dance form of India, the same facility being not available there. We were grooming students over there in regular basis for 5 years (2008 to 2012) so that they learned Odissi from experts and be at par with children of bigger cities and metros. We also have sections of special children and under privileged children, who are not in a position to pay for their dance lessons and also are taking part in all programmes and other activities of our organization and sit for the yearly dance examinations absolutely free of cost. Every year we organize major programmes exclusively on classical dance where children show their proficiency and talents to the august audiences with much applaud and recognition. We are regularly being invited by notable Central Government concerns like ICCR, EZCC, also our State Govt - DEPARTMENT OF CULTURE, DEPT OF TOURISM, DEPT OF FOREST and other distinguished association to perform in prestigious festivals and programmes like Uday Shankar Dance Festival, Independence Day progm, Indian Navy Progm, Rajya Sangeet Academy, India International Centre, Forest Dept, Govt. of West Bengal, Other Government festivals, etc. Another very notable activity of our organisation under the valued leadership of Debamitra Sengupta - Regular weekly Dance Teaching and Counseling at the ALIPORE CORRECTIONAL HOME FOR WOMEN & CHILDREN , KOLKATA looking after the physical and mental well being of the women inmates and their children over there at the Correctional Home. An enriched archive is a treasure of this academy. An invaluable resource to the dance community with huge compilation of audio and video recordings of Odissi items both popular and rare choreographies by Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra, Smt. Sanjukta Panigrahi, and Smt. Debamitra Sengupta. Special care and attention has been given in the process of documentation and compilation. The association with the academy will be a matter of pride to any student and scholar who would like to perfect their dance form and build up academic knowledge to carry on further research on the subject.

detailsOfAchievement: KOLKATA NANDANIK started its journey on 1st April, 1984. For almost twenty-nine years its relentless effort has been to bridge the gap between the common man and the artists and the world of art. All these long years our ceaseless effort has been to make people culture conscious. We have tried to organize art exhibition not in any particular gallery or place, but within the reach of common people. And success has increased our self-confidence and daring. As a result of this we have arranged for art exhibition and art workshops on footpaths and open spaces, places where common men frequent and have easy access. Many eminent artists and painters (like Bijan Choudhury, Prakash Karmokar, Ganesh Halui, Ganesh Pyne and so on) have taken part in such programs, and simultaneously we have received liberal praise, love, warmth and co-operation from one and all. Not being content with this, we have endeavored to make our progress enlivened with new thoughts and ideas. We started our activity with emphasis on the social aspects. Consequently, we held poster exhibition and painting exhibition in various districts of West Bengal. We also arranged for an art exhibition (sculpture and painting) in Lalit Kala Akademi by way of encouraging young artists. Our theme was contemporary issues we tried to enter the depths of human psyche through experimental forms. Within our limited resources we have often tried to bring world renowned artists from both Bangladesh and West Bengal together, and make them participate in art exhibitions and workshops, which have now become a regular annual event. With the aim of making the common man aware of the world of art - to develop his sense of morality and humane values we, after some deliberation, published a magazine dealing with the subject of fine arts. Nandanik Samoy, the effort of a small organization has made its mark within the intelligentsia. Such a magazine dealing only with the subject of art is rare and singular. Madhubani art is an aboriginal art form. To make this art popular in the city, we arranged for and conducted training camps for this purpose. This has given much satisfaction to the art lovers. This organization has developed itself unfailingly to many a social cause - to prevent the wastage of drinking water and that of environmental pollution, to maintain communal harmony and to oppose separatism. It is our constant endeavor to give the underprivileged children and economic footing and to kindle a sense of social awareness in the young generation of today. We have always tried our best to make the world of the young lively and colorful through observance of Rabindranath Tagores birth anniversary, Matri Bhasa Dibas (Vernacular Day), educational excursions and conducting theatre workshops and plays enacted by children, and through Prabhat Pheri (singing of awakening songs in procession). We conduct continuously special training program on commercial art, Fabric art on cloth, craft work etc. We are committed to continue all these in the coming years also.
